result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W Everroad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay child support in full directly to the child support agency, pursuant to prior order. Must seek work and comply with all child support obligations. Must notify w/in 48hrs if change of address. Must report by 2pm on 7/18/2016 to child support.

records.addlTxt: DNA Submisson Form

Defendant, Thomas W Everroad appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  State speaks to the court-no additions or corrections to the PSI.  Atty Chapman speaks to the court re: PSI.  State and Atty Chapman request to follow the PSI. Mr. Everroad speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties re: sentencing. 
Sentencing--2 years probation. Conditions: Pay child support in full pursuant to prior order, seek work. Comply w/ all obligations.  Must notify w/in 48 hrs if change of address. 112 jail, credit 112 days. Must report by 2pm to child support.  DNA Surcharge + costs,
to Release the PSI
in Posting Bond
Sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Thomas W Everroad in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Thomas W Everroad in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Chapman offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court questions the Def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis.  

Count 1-Dismissed but Read-In
Count 2-Def. pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.  
Count 3-Dismissed but Read-In
Count 4-Dismissed but Read-In
Count 5-Dismissed but Read-In

Court orders a PSI-Agent need not appear. 

Atty Chapman speaks re: Bail modification.  State speaks re: bail.    

Court amends bail bond to $500.00 cash. He may leave the state of WI, but must call DOC to arrange the PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
for bail modification

Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks to the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court orders that Mr. Everroad needs to be on evaluated. Set out for plea. 
  Status hrg or plea scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Status conference at 04-21-2016 11:00 am
Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered as to all counts.
Address: 201 Walnut Street. Spooner, WI 54801 Must reside there.  Curfew from 9pm-6am. Must be at Spooner residence.

Defendant Thomas W Everroad in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Thomas W Everroad in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. State calls Kelly Swan to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Swan.  State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Chapman. No further questions. Witness is excused.  State calls Joy Melton to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Melton. State begins questioning.  Court finds the witness has identified the def.  No further questions from the state. Cross from Atty Chapman.  Nothing further. Witness is excused. Argument.  Court finds there is probable cause. 
Atty Chapman speaks re: bond.  asking to reduce bond to $500 cash. 
Bail amended to $500 cash. Must reside at 201 Walnut Street.
Curfew from  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Thomas W Everroad in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.

Court recites case and appearances. 5187 HWY 47 W, Vanleer, Tennessee. $9,000 cash. February 22, 2016 at 10:45 a.m. Mr. Everroad to contact Public Defender's Office.

Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court.  Angeline E Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  No appearance by defendant.  Atty McL speaks to the court.   State asks for Bench Warrant.  Bench Warrant issued. Body Only, extraditable. $25,000.00.
